questions.question: According to the framework that defines product innovations, there is an incremental innovation when:
answers: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
questions.correctAnswer: Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are reinforced

questions.question: According to the framework that defines product innovations, there is an architectural innovation when:
answers: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
questions.correctAnswer: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are reinforced

questions.question: According to the framework that defines product innovations, there is a modular innovation when:
answers: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
questions.correctAnswer: Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are substituted

questions.question: According to the framework that defines product innovations, there is a radical innovation when:
answers: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
Architecture Relations are unchanged, and Knowledge Components are substituted
Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are reinforced
questions.correctAnswer: Architecture Relations are altered, and Knowledge Components are substituted

questions.question: In the competitive strategy, the question “Who are our customers?” is connected to the following strategic dimension:
answers: Customer intimacy
Product leadership
Operational excellence
It is connected to all of them
questions.correctAnswer: Customer intimacy

questions.question: In the competitive strategy, the question “What do we offer them?” is connected to the following strategic dimension:
answers: Customer intimacy
Product leadership
Operational excellence
It is connected to all of them
questions.correctAnswer: Product leadership

questions.question: In the competitive strategy, the question “How can we deliver it effectively and efficiently?” is connected to the following strategic dimension:
answers: Customer intimacy
Product leadership
Operational excellence
It is connected to all of them
questions.correctAnswer: Operational excellence

questions.question: Which of these is not a source of strategic innovation?
answers: Design-Driven innovation
Technology Push innovation
Market Pull innovation
Data-Driven innovation
questions.correctAnswer: Data-Driven innovation

questions.question: Defining the target market and identifying consumer unfulfilled needs allows companies to pursue a:
answers: Desgin-Driven innovation
Technology Push innovation
Market Pull innovation
None of them
questions.correctAnswer: Market Pull innovation

questions.question: Developing innovative products or services and providing a unique meaning to existing goods enables companies to pursue a:
answers: Design-Driven innovation
Technology Push innovation
Market Pull innovation
None of them
questions.correctAnswer: Design-Driven innovation

questions.question: Optimizing production processes and developing new products to satisfy previously unidentified consumer needs allows companies to pursue a:
answers: Desgin-driven innovation
Technology push innovation
Market pull innovation
None of them
questions.correctAnswer: Technology push innovation

questions.question: Ecosystem partners are:
answers: Organizations weakly interconnected with each other, although dependent on each other for their survival
Artists, cultural organizations, sociologists, anthropologists, marketing and media expert who explore socio-cultural trends
Producers of innovative as well as professional machinery and plants that lead to the identification of technology trends in terms of production processes
Manufacturers of hardware and software components who contribute to identifying digital trends
questions.correctAnswer: Organizations weakly interconnected with each other, although dependent on each other for their survival

questions.question: If a company decides to serve a tribe:
answers: It doesn’t distinguish customers based on their demographic geographic and behavioral characteristics
It brings together two or more distinct but interdependent customer groups though a digital platform
It identifies various customer groups based on their passions, interests and experiences that make them capable of collective action
It distinguishes each customer each customer from others, exploiting the possibilities offered by Industry 4.0
questions.correctAnswer: It identifies various customer groups based on their passions, interests and experiences that make them capable of collective action

questions.question: Which of these is not a Building Block of the Business Model Canvas?
answers: Society
Products
Technology
Resources
questions.correctAnswer: Technology

questions.question: Which tool can be used to verify whether a company is strategically aligned in all its strategic dimensions?
answers: The business model framework
The business model canvas
The digital operating model
The strategic fit matrix
questions.correctAnswer: The strategic fit matrix

questions.question: What type of production is carried out in the 1st Industrial Revolution?
answers: Flexible production
Mass production
Centralized production
Intelligent production
questions.correctAnswer: Centralized production

questions.question: What type of production is carried out in the 2nd Industrial Revolution?
answers: Flexible production
Mass production
Centralized production
Intelligent production
questions.correctAnswer: Mass production

questions.question: What type of production is carried out in the 3rd Industrial Revolution?
answers: Flexible production
Mass production
Centralized production
Intelligent production
questions.correctAnswer: Flexible production

questions.question: What type of production is carried out in the 4th Industrial Revolution?
answers: Flexible production
Mass production
Centralized production
Intelligent production
questions.correctAnswer: Intelligent production

questions.question: Which are the generic technological strategies?
answers: Openness and closure
Complexification and simplification
Usability and security
None of the answer is correct
questions.correctAnswer: Openness and closure

questions.question: Some operational objectives related to the “openness and freedom of system” strategy are:
answers: Complexification, ownership and flexibility
Centralization, predictability and efficiency
Reactivity, automation and simplification
Decentralization, interoperability and augmentation
questions.correctAnswer: Decentralization, interoperability and augmentation

questions.question: Some operational objectives related to the “closure and control of the system” strategy are:
answers: Complexification, ownership and flexibility
Centralization, predictability and efficiency
Reactivity, automation and simplification
Decentralization, interoperability and augmentation
questions.correctAnswer: Reactivity, automation and simplification

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the nine digital paradigms?
answers: Digital manufacturing
Cloud Computing
Artificial Intelligence
Cyber Security
questions.correctAnswer: Artificial Intelligence

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the nine digital paradigms?
answers: Industrial Internet of Things
Blockchain
Big Data Analytics
System integration
questions.correctAnswer: Blockchain

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Digital Manufacturing paradigm impact the internalization strategy?
answers: Reduction in the optimal size of production sites (reduces economies of scale)
Reduction in the use of unskilled labour and, therefore, the convenience of low-cost relocation strategies
Reduction in the time and costs (transport, warehouse and customs duties) of delivering products to the customer
Increase in external collaboration in product design
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the use of unskilled labour and, therefore, the convenience of low-cost relocation strategies

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Digital Manufacturing paradigm impact the ownership strategy?
answers: Reduction in the number of suppliers, in particular, those specialized in the production of complex parts (self-production of components)
Increase in external collaboration in product design
Increase in the creation of products  with new features
Increase in product customization
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the number of suppliers, in particular, those specialized in the production of complex parts (self-production of components)

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Digital Manufacturing paradigm impact the efficiency strategy?
answers: Reduction in the optimal size of production sites (reduces economies of scale)
Reduction in product development time and costs (time-to-market and learning economies)
Reduction in the number of items in stock (elimination of components for products, self-production of some components)
Increase in freedom in product design by fostering individual creativity and the birth of new ideas
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the number of items in stock (elimination of components for products, self-production of some components)

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Digital Manufacturing paradigm impact the flexibility strategy?
answers: Reduction in the use of unskilled labour and, therefore, the convenience of low cost relocation strategies
Reduction in the number of items in stock (elimination of components for products, self-production of some components)
Reduction in the time and costs (including customs) of procurement (self-production of some components)
Reduction in assembly costs (fewer components)
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the use of unskilled labour and, therefore, the convenience of low cost relocation strategies

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Autonomous and Collaborative Robots paradigm impact the externalization strategy?
answers: Increase in efficiency and effectiveness in production planning and control
Possibility to enable complex processing optimizing process variables (machine learning)
Increase in labour productivity by promoting human-to machine interaction
Possibility to enable decentralized production control
questions.correctAnswer: Possibility to enable decentralized production control

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Autonomous and Collaborative Robots paradigm impact the automation strategy?
answers: Increase in efficiency and effectiveness in production planning and control
Increase in labour productivity by promoting human-to -machine interaction
Increase in the optimization of just-in-time and just-in-sequence deliveries
Increase in product customization
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in efficiency and effectiveness in production planning and control

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Autonomous and Collaborative Robots paradigm impact the augmentation strategy?
answers: Increase in flexibility without compromising the quality of the work
Possibility to enable complex processing by simplifying human activities
Increase in labour productivity by promoting human-to-machine interaction
Possibility to enable decentralized production control
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in labour productivity by promoting human-to-machine interaction

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Autonomous and Collaborative Robots paradigm impact the decentralization strategy?
answers: Possibility to enable complex processing optimizing process variables (machine learning)
Possibility to enable decentralized production control
Increase in the optimization of just-in-time and just-in-sequence deliveries
Increase in production customization
questions.correctAnswer: Possibility to enable decentralized production control

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Autonomous and Collaborative Robots paradigm impact the simplification strategy?
answers: Possibility to enable the replacement of human operators in repetitive, strenuous, and risky activities
Possibility to enable complex processing optimizing process variables (machine learning)
Increase in the accuracy of the assembly simplifying human activities
Increase in product customization
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the accuracy of the assembly simplifying human activities

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Augmented and Virtual Reality paradigm impact the externalization strategy?
answers: Reduction in training time for new and seasonal workers
Increase in quality control
Reduction in repair times through guided maintenance procedures
Opportunity to enable the possibility of making aesthetic and functional product tests with customers
questions.correctAnswer:
Opportunity to enable the possibility of making aesthetic and functional product tests with
customers

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Augmented and Virtual Reality paradigm have an impact on the reactivity strategy?
answers: Opportunity to enable safer and more controlled training environment for workers
Increase in the conformity of the goods taken from the warehouse with what is requested
Reduction in repair times through guided maintenance procedures
Increase in the customer experience
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in repair times through guided maintenance procedures

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Augmented and Virtual Reality paradigm impact the efficiency strategy?
answers: Increase in the accuracy in the location of the goods stock
Opportunity to enable new forms of human-to-machine interaction in production and maintenance processes
Opportunity to enable the possibility of making aesthetic and functional product tests with customers
Increase in the customer experience
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the accuracy in the location of the goods stock

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Augmented and Virtual Reality paradigm impact the flexibility strategy?
answers: Reduction in training time for new and seasonal workers
Opportunity to enable new forms of human-to-machine interaction in production and maintenance processes
Reduction repair times through guided maintenance procedures
Increase in the customer experience
questions.correctAnswer:
Opportunity to enable new forms of human-to-machine interaction in production and
maintenance processes

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Augmented and Virtual Reality paradigm impact the prediction strategy?
answers: Opportunity to enable a safer and more controlled training environment for workers
Increase in quality control
Reduction in human error and downtime by increasing the availability of all relevant information in real time
Increase in collaboration and learning on the field among more people remotely in production and maintenance processes
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in human error and downtime by increasing the availability of all relevant information in real time

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Internet of Things paradigm impact the centralization strategy?
answers: Opportunity to enable the real-time location of materials and products along the supply chain
Increase in work productivity by continuously monitoring working conditions
Reduction in product repair time by signalling the need for maintenance before the product breaks
Increase in the simplicity of use of the product by reducing human intervention
questions.correctAnswer: Opportunity to enable the real-time location of materials and products along the supply chain

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Internet of Things paradigm impact the interoperability strategy?
answers: Increase in work productivity by continuously monitoring working conditions
Increase in the accuracy of the verification of the conditions of transport and storage of the products
Increase in communication and interaction between intelligent products (through decision-making capabilities) and centralized controlling units
Reduction in the role of intermediaries in the relationship with the customer
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in communication and interaction between intelligent products (through decision- making capabilities) and centralized controlling units

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Internet of Things paradigm impact the flexibility strategy?
answers: Increase in work productivity by continuously monitoring working conditions
Increase in the accuracy of the verification of the conditions of transport and storage of the products
Reduction in unexpected failures and the amount of preventive maintenance for products
Increase in the offer of personalized and automated services by leveraging IoT data
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the offer of personalized and automated services by leveraging IoT data

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Internet of Things paradigm impact the internalization strategy?
answers: Opportunity to enable the real-time location of materials and products along the supply chain
Increase in efficiency in supply chain management by continuously integrating more detailed information from the various partners in the supply chain
Reduction in unexpected failures and the amount of preventive maintenance for products
Reduction in the role of intermediaries in the relationship with the customer
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the role of intermediaries in the relationship with the customer

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Internet of Things paradigm impact the automation strategy?
answers: Increase in work productivity by continuously monitoring working conditions
Reduction in unexpected failures and the amount of preventive maintenance for machinery
Reduction in the role of intermediaries in the relationship with the customer
Opportunity to enable the real-time location of materials and products along the supply chain
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in unexpected failures and the amount of preventive maintenance for machinery

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Cloud Computing paradigm impact the security strategy?
answers: Reduction in the cost for initial investments and subsequent maintenance of physical infrastructures and software applications
Increase in the inviolability of physical infrastructures and software applications by centralizing cybersecurity procedures
Increase in process monitoring and control
Increase in data sharing between sites and organizational boundaries
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the inviolability of physical infrastructures and software applications by centralizing cybersecurity procedures

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Cloud Computing paradigm impact the efficiency strategy?
answers: Reduction in the cost for the use of physical infrastructures making them infrastructure as-a-service (IaaS)
Increase in the inviolability of physical infrastructures and software applications by centralizing cybersecurity procedures
Possibility to enable the use of physical infrastructures and immediately scalable software applications
Increase in data sharing between sites and organizational boundaries
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the cost for the use of physical infrastructures making them infrastructure as- a-service (IaaS)

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Cloud Computing paradigm impact the externalization strategy?
answers: Reduction in the risk of technological obsolescence of physical infrastructures and software applications
Reduction in energy waste in the use of physical infrastructures by exploiting economies of scale
Increase in the inviolability of physical infrastructures and software applications by centralizing cybersecurity procedures
Possibility to enable the use of physical infrastructures and software applications at all times
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the risk of technological obsolescence of physical infrastructures and software applications

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Cloud Computing paradigm impact the centralization strategy?
answers: Reduction in the risk of technological obsolescence of physical infrastructures and software applications
Possibility to enable the use of physical infrastructures and software applications everywhere
Increase in process monitoring and control
Increase in data sharing between sites and organizational boundaries
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in process monitoring and control

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Industrial Cloud Computing paradigm impact the simplification strategy?
answers: Reduction in the cost for the use of software applications making them as-a-service (SaaS)
Possibility to enable the use of physical infrastructures and software applications at all times
Possibility to enable the use of physical infrastructures and immediately scalable software applications
Increase in process monitoring and control
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in process monitoring and control

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Simulation paradigm impact the prediction strategy?
answers: Increase in the information on the residual time of use or storage of component parts also to identify those that can be reused
Increase in the iterations of designing new products and processes
Reduction in the risks of incorrect design reflecting the requests of users in the realization of the product
Reduction in the time and cost of reconfiguring machinery and systems by continuously adapting them to the dynamic production context
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the information on the residual time of use or storage of component parts also to identify those that can be reused

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Simulation paradigm impact the usability strategy?
answers: Increase in the information on the residual time of use or storage of component parts also to identify those that can be reused
Increase in the efficiency in the use of internal handling equipment by simulating the different assembly phases
Reduction in the risks of incorrect design by preventing potential errors through the simulation of product behavior
Opportunity to enable the design of advanced environmental management services
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the risks of incorrect design by preventing potential errors through the simulation of product behavior

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Simulation paradigm have an impact on the decentralization strategy?
answers: Reduction in the costs (economic and environmental) of procurement by foreseeing the costs in the choice of alternative suppliers
Increase in the iterations of designing new products and processes
Reduction in the risks of incorrect design reflecting the requests of users in the realization of the product
Possibility to enable the design of advanced environmental management services
questions.correctAnswer: Reduction in the costs (economic and environmental) of procurement by foreseeing the costs in the choice of alternative suppliers

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Simulation paradigm impact the externalization strategy?
answers: Increase in the information on the residual time of use or storage of component parts also to identify those that can be reused
Increase in the possibility of collaboration at the supply chain level by simulating the overall process, forecasting economic, social and environmental performance
Increase in the efficiency in the use of internal handling equipment by simulating the different assembly phases
Reduction in the risks of incorrect design by preventing potential errors through the simulation of product behaviour
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the possibility of collaboration at the supply chain level by simulating the overall process, forecasting economic, social and environmental performance

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Simulation paradigm impact the flexibility strategy?
answers: Reduction in the costs (economic and environmental) of procurement by foreseeing the costs in the choice of alternative suppliers
Increase in the information on the residual time of use or storage of component parts also to identify those that can be reused
Increase in the iterations of designing new products and processes
Increase in control by monitoring the correctness and efficiency of the production process
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the iterations of designing new products and processes

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Big Data Analytics (descriptive analytics) paradigm impacts the efficiency strategy?
answers: Increase in quality of insight generation that help solve customer issues and increase customer experience
Increase in quality in the search for purchasing commonalities to negotiate better pricing
Increase in quality of the tracking of goods along the supply chain for demand planning
Increase in quality of the tracking of product usage, performance, and positioning
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in quality in the search for purchasing commonalities to negotiate better pricing

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Big Data Analytics (predictive analytics) paradigm impacts the automation strategy?
answers: Increase in the speed of adjusting the regular behaviour of machines with their expected behavior
Increase in the ability of improving the user service experience
Increase in the ability of differentiating and developing innovative products and services
Increase in the ability of providing better services thanks to the identification of future customer behaviour
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the speed of adjusting the regular behaviour of machines with their expected behavior

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Big Data Analytics (predictive analytics) paradigm impacts the efficiency strategy?
answers: Increase in the ability of improving the user service experience
Increase in the ability of differentiating and developing innovative products and services
Increase in the speed of activating quality control for the maintenance of machinery and products
Increase in the capability of uncovering patterns, tracking movements, and analysing customer preferences to make more accurate market profiling and segmentation
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the speed of activating quality control for the maintenance of machinery and products

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Big Data Analytics (prescriptive analytics) paradigm impacts the efficiency strategy?
answers: Increase in rapidity in response to market demand
Increase in real-time planning of energy consumption savings during breaks, reducing machine consumption
Increase in the ability to modify routes of vehicles in real-time based on unforeseen events
Increase in the capability to anticipate design flaws and correct them
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in real-time planning of energy consumption savings during breaks, reducing machine consumption

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Structural Horizontal and Vertical System Integration paradigm impact the decentralization strategy?
answers: Increase in information sharing with suppliers
Reduction in production times by improving the use of machinery thanks to real-time planning
Increase in decision-making support based on up-to-date production information and incoming orders
Reduction in time-to-market
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in information sharing with suppliers

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Structural Horizontal and Vertical System Integration paradigm impact the interoperability strategy?
answers: Increase in decision-making support based on up-to-date production information and incoming orders
Reduction in delivery times by coordinating and adapting production and distribution processes
Increase in customer relations by facilitating joint product design
Increase in the flexible and dynamic interaction between partners in the production process
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the flexible and dynamic interaction between partners in the production process

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Structural Horizontal and Vertical System Integration paradigm impact the reactivity strategy?
answers: Reduction in time-to-market
Increase in control over digital channels and smart products to improve the customer experience
Increase in the traceability of data horizontally along the supply chain thanks to signalling systems
Increase in customer relations by facilitating joint product design
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the traceability of data horizontally along the supply chain thanks to signalling systems

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Structural Horizontal and Vertical System Integration paradigm impact the flexibility strategy?
answers: Increase in the capacity for self-organization and flexible reconfiguration of production lines for customized products
Increase in the efficiency in the use of resources thanks to sharing between collaborative networks
Reduction in production times by improving the use of machinery thanks to real-time planning
Reduction in delivery times by coordinating and adapting production and distribution processes
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in the capacity for self-organization and flexible reconfiguration of production lines for customized products

questions.question: Which of the following “Operational Benefits” of the Structural Horizontal and Vertical System Integration paradigm impact the complexification strategy?
answers: Increase in customer relations by facilitating joint product design
Increase in interaction between products to perform complex cooperation tasks
Reduction in time-to-market
Reduction in production times by improving the use of machinery thanks to real-time planning
questions.correctAnswer: Increase in interaction between products to perform complex cooperation tasks

questions.question: Building an agile and hybrid organization may represent a valid solution:
answers: to design and build sound software tools
to survive and thrive through digital disruption
to encompass more digital processes
to nourish the organization’s competitive advantage
questions.correctAnswer: to survive and thrive through digital disruption

questions.question: The connection between business models and technology:
answers: Both need to be coherent
technology influences business models and business models necessitate the use of technologies
business models influence the chosen technology
technology influences business models and technologies necessitate business models
questions.correctAnswer: technology influences business models and technologies necessitate business models

questions.question: Technological advancements:
answers: Have proper economic value
Have no economic value
Have an economic value, which is challenging to measure
Have an economic value if they are properly implemented within business models
questions.correctAnswer: Have an economic value if they are properly implemented within business models

questions.question: A business model which is driven by the Industry 4.0 digital paradigms:
answers: will use technologies as an input in order to extract value and generate a valuable output for its customer base
will use technologies as an input to speed up production and become more efficient
will use technologies to innovate all its building blocks
will use technologies to create new products and services.
questions.correctAnswer: will use technologies as an input in order to extract value and generate a valuable output for its customer base

questions.question: Data-driven business models are typically adopted by organizations operating:
answers: B2B
B2C
C2B
Can be implemented by any business and or consumer models
questions.correctAnswer: C2B

questions.question: Customer-to-Business (C2B) sector means:
answers: markets within which innovative products are designed and developed from the data generated and collected as a result of product utilization as well as product-user interactions
markets within which innovative products are gathered directly from customers
markets within which customers create and deliver innovative products with the support of the organizations
markets in which innovative products are the results of a multistakeholder active participation and cooperation.
questions.correctAnswer: markets within which innovative products are designed and developed from the data generated and collected as a result of product utilization as well as product-user interactions

questions.question: Platform business models are typically adopted by organizations operating:
answers: B2B
C2B
C2C
Can be implemented by any business and or consumer models
questions.correctAnswer: C2C

questions.question: Smart factory business models are typically adopted by organizations operating:
answers: B2B
C2B
C2C
Can be implemented by any business and or consumer models
questions.correctAnswer: B2B

questions.question: Servitization business models are typically adopted by organizations operating:
answers: B2B
C2B
B2C
Can be implemented by any business and or consumer models
questions.correctAnswer: B2C

questions.question: Smart factory business models are associated with the strategic dimension of:
answers: Operational excellence
Product leadership
Customer intimacy
Ecosystem leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Operational excellence

questions.question: Servitization business models are associated with the strategic dimension of:
answers: Operational excellence
Product leadership
Customer intimacy
Ecosystem leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Product leadership

questions.question: Data driven business models are associated with the strategic dimension of:
answers: Operational excellence
Product leadership
Customer intimacy
Ecosystem leadership

questions.question: Platform business models are associated with the strategic dimension of:
answers: Operational excellence
Product leadership
Customer intimacy
Ecosystem leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Ecosystem leadership

questions.question: Datafication means:
answers: generation and collection of data and the extraction of valuable knowledge
data analysis and the extraction of valuable knowledge
big data analytics the extraction of valuable knowledge
data measurement and the extraction of valuable knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: generation and collection of data and the extraction of valuable knowledge

questions.question: Organizations achieve economies of scale through:
answers: a wider variety of goods and services
production level increments
price increase
production efficiency measures
questions.correctAnswer: production level increments

questions.question: Organizations achieve economies of scope and complementarities through:
answers: a wider variety of goods and services
production level increments
price increase
production efficiency measures

questions.question: Operating models refer to the abstract and visual representation of the modalities through which organizations:
answers: understand the best marketing ways to enter new business segments
structure their core processes and deliver value to their customers
structure their core processes to increase their efficacy and effectiveness
structure their core processes to reduce the costs of the operations
questions.correctAnswer: structure their core processes and deliver value to their customers

questions.question: Operating models:
answers: are standardized
although they can be employed by any organization, are particularly relevant for large corporations
can range from simple to complex
should follow some best practices.
questions.correctAnswer: can range from simple to complex

questions.question: Digital scale, scope and learning:
answers: are able to reshape the nature of competitive advantage
do not affect company dimension
can represent a challenge that organizations need to address
represent a doubtful advantage
questions.correctAnswer: are able to reshape the nature of competitive advantage

questions.question: Monetization means:
answers: generating value from a particular product or service
generating data from a particular product or service
generating competitive advantage from a particular product or service
generating money from a particular product or service
questions.correctAnswer: generating money from a particular product or service

questions.question: In digital companies:
answers: The marginal cost of serving an additional user on multiple digital networks is higher than that of non-digital companies
The marginal cost of serving an additional user on multiple digital networks is limited
The marginal cost of serving an additional user on multiple digital networks is close to zero
The marginal cost of serving an additional user on multiple digital networks cannot be overlooked
questions.correctAnswer: The marginal cost of serving an additional user on multiple digital networks is close to zero

questions.question: In digital companies, learning and innovation are:
answers: Faster
More efficient
More challenging
Not relevant
questions.correctAnswer: Faster

questions.question: Digital operating models:
answers: Must be aligned with digital business model to optimize performance
Can enable faster learning and innovation
Are able to transform industries and reshape competitive advantage
All the answers are correct
questions.correctAnswer: All the answers are correct

questions.question: Digital operating models are based on:
answers: Data monetization
Software development
Customer intimacy
Data generation
questions.correctAnswer: Software development

questions.question: Product dematerialization refers to:
answers: cyber services available to users
data available to users
cyber goods available to users
tangible goods available to users
questions.correctAnswer: cyber goods available to users

questions.question: A bug is:
answers: a fault causing a program to crash or to produce invalid output
a cyber attack which should be followed by cyber resilience activities
a cyber attack which should be followed by cyber security activities
a technical issue of the system
questions.correctAnswer: a fault causing a program to crash or to produce invalid output

questions.question: ETL stands for:
answers: extraction, transformation and logging
extraction, translation and loading
extraction, translation and logging
extraction, transformation and loading
questions.correctAnswer: extraction, transformation and loading

questions.question: In the process of resolving bugs within software or computer programs, “open data” is part of the:
answers: Society building block
Internal processes building block
Resources building block
External processes building block
questions.correctAnswer: Society building block

questions.question: In a randomized control trial, the treatment refers to:
answers: Random users who experience the innovation
Random users who keep using the original system

answers: Bezos has never been interested in open innovation

Amazon has started resorting to open innovation only in the last years, obtaining great results
Amazon has always been oriented to open innovation, albeit with logic and results that have evolved over time
questions.correctAnswer: Amazon has always been oriented to open innovation, albeit with logic and results that have evolved over time

questions.question: Which digital business model(s) is (are) traceable to the step “Amazon as an e-commerce and distributor”?
answers: Data-driven business model and platform business model

Smart factory business model

answers: Data-driven business model and platform business model

questions.question: What does it mean for Amazon to be an “unstore”?
answers: It is bound by the traditional rules or customs of doing business in the commerce sector
It is constrained by what is deemed best for the customer
It has limitless shelf space and offers standardized services for each customer
None of them
questions.correctAnswer: It is constrained by what is deemed best for the customer

questions.question: Considering Amazon as an e-commerce and distributor:
answers: There is an interconnection between its physical infrastructure and machines and their respective digital twins
Its network extends upstream, next to its suppliers and partners, but not downstream
There is an interconnection between its physical infrastructure and machines and its digital systems
Its network extends downstream, including transport logistic operators and customers, but not upstream
questions.correctAnswer: There is an interconnection between its physical infrastructure and machines and its digital systems

questions.question: Considering Amazon as a marketplace platform, the possibility for third-party retailers to sell their products on Amazon.com:
answers: Allowed Amazon to appear as the digital store that could offer the widest selection of products at the most affordable price
Reduced Amazon’s product assortment because of substitution effect
Was clearly the right choice and Immediately generated excitement among buyers
Didn’t involve competitors finalizing the sale in its place
questions.correctAnswer: Allowed Amazon to appear as the digital store that could offer the widest selection of products at the most affordable pric

questions.question: Considering Amazon as a service provider, the introduction of Amazon Web Services (AWS):
answers: Has made Amazon the technology partner for the successful development of a digital business ecosystem based on cloud computing
Allows Amazon to build strong and long-term relationships with customer
Has created a very profitable business model and has given Amazon a leading role in the emergence of colud computing technology
All the answers are correct
questions.correctAnswer: All the answers are correct

questions.question: Considering Amazon as a phygital product/store platform, the devices introduced by Amazon:
answers: Enable a software add-on business model
Present a dual nature, digital-first and product-first
Generate value by the systemic integration of the product and service components
All the answers are correct
questions.correctAnswer: Generate value by the systemic integration of the product and service components
